metadata.title: CVE-2023-38709 on Ubuntu 24.04 LTS (noble) - medium
metadata.description:
Faulty input validation in the core of Apache allows malicious orexploitable backend/content generators to split HTTP responses.This issue affects Apache HTTP Server: through 2.4.58.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2023-38709` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

apache2 - 2.4.58-1ubuntu8.1
apache2-bin - 2.4.58-1ubuntu8.1
apache2-data - 2.4.58-1ubuntu8.1
apache2-suexec-custom - 2.4.58-1ubuntu8.1
apache2-suexec-pristine - 2.4.58-1ubuntu8.1
apache2-utils - 2.4.58-1ubuntu8.1
libapache2-mod-md - 2.4.58-1ubuntu8.1
libapache2-mod-proxy-uwsgi - 2.4.58-1ubuntu8.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: apache2 package in noble was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.4.58-1ubuntu8.1').
